lines.text: [a passenger offers her ring to the stagecoach robbers]
No thanks, lady. I ain't the marryin' kind.
Ain't you going to rob us, too?
Tuesday's chicken feed day. This is Wednesday.
That wasn't a man! That was a ghost! So was his horse. Why he didn't make a sound. He just...
Ah, it's a grassy meadow out yonder. Nobody makes a sound crossing a grassy meadow - except you and your big mouth.
Mucho gracias, senor. I always speak Spanish when I'm eatin' - gives it a better flavor.
[Johnny accuses the Courteens of trying to bushwhack him]
Ha! You're loco. Deputy sheriffs sometimes get that way. It's usually a sign they've lived too long.

[to Luke]
A man that ain't no good at gun slingin' ain't no good to me - even if he is my son.
